refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The scan operator reads a stored array from disk. The output of the scan operator is an array the same size as stored_array. The argument stored_array must be an array that was previously created and stored in SciDB.
The scan operator is most useful for displaying a stored array on stdout from the AFL language.

informalexample.para: This example creates, builds, and stores an array, then shows the cell values in that array.

step.para: Create a 3×3 array m3x3: --afl CREATE ARRAY m3x3<val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0]; --show-query=yes --show-output=no
Put values of 0–8 into m3x3: --afl store(build(m3x3,i*3+j),m3x3); --show-query=yes --show-output=no
Use scan in an AFL statement to display m3x3: --afl scan(m3x3); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes
